definition[1]: someone who owns or controls a lot of money and lends it to businesses, banks etc to produce more wealth
example[1]: The country has really changed; it’s OK to be a capitalist now.
definition[3]: someone who owns or controls a lot of money and lends it to businesses to create more wealth
example[2]: The country has finally captured foreign capitalists’ attention, if not yet their investment.
example[3]: leaders of the Group of Seven largest capitalist democracies
example[4]: Beijing agreed to maintain Hong Kong’s capitalist system for at least 50 years.
